jcr2102 wrote:
> When crawling a single host, my download rate reachs only 2 urls per
> second. I'd like to increase the rate until either the client or the
> server's resources are maxed out. At 2 pages per seconds, both the
> client and the server have plenty of bandwidth & cpu to spare.
> 
> So far I've reduced the frontier's min-delay-ms to 0, but the rate
> only changed slightly. I notice that only 2 of the 50 available
> threads are active at any given time. Could this be the source of the
> rate limit? If so, how can I increase the number of active threads?
> 
> Btw, I own the targetted web server, so politeness is no concern.

Delay is calculated as the time the last fetch took, times the 
'delay-factor', but no less than 'min-delay-ms' nor more than 
'max-delay-ms'.

So you should also zero 'max-delay-ms' or 'delay-factor' (or both) 
to completely eliminate politeness delays.

Heritrix will still only open one connection to a single hostname 
at a time, but this may be fast enough for you. (An earlier 
frontier implementation had an option for processing multiple URLs 
from a single queue/host at once, but the option was not carried 
forward to the current recommended frontier implementation. It may 
return as an option in a future version.)

- Gordon @ IA
